intro: Thesium cinereum, commonly known as the silver thesium, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing a dense foliage that helps it thrive in well-drained, acidic soils. Thesium cinereum is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
